text: turf territory an actual functioning
state that was the promise that Isis
gave its followers as it seized city
after city in Iraq and Syria building
the so-called Caliphate was an essential
part of their self-proclaimed destiny
but now in one stinging defeat after
another the group has lost its
strongholds how does it maintain
credibility in the face of epic losses
Isis now has to move its goal posts it
has to shift its message from utopia to
nostalgia in Araku Syria it's retreating
into a guerrilla insurgency buying time
and online it'll continue to urge
followers to fight in their home
countries at first isis cherry-picked
the quran and ancient islamic prophecies
and declared their goal as tom kean
meaning territorial strength as promised
by God in the Quran Allah the chief
communications strategist Abu Mohammed
al-adnani said if the group failed to
achieve this God should punish people
destroy them when Isis succeeded in
seizing Syrian and Iraqi territory
it appeared to followers that God was on
the group side their evil remaining
unchecked the ancient Islamic prophecies
also mentioned tyranny before a
Caliphate Isis conveniently branded the
u.s. in the West is tyrannical
adversaries and the group seized our
Beck a syrian town prophesied to be the
site of a great battle against Rome's
armies to spark the end of days
the group was so confident after taking
dar back that they appeared to tout
another goal beyond holding territory to
usher in the apocalypse so they can meet
their maker in their lifetimes but
instead of being met by Rome's armies
they were met with relentless airstrikes
they lost our back in an unremarkable
battle in summer 2015
Isis's territorial successes peaked but
they had also started losing ground so
their message shifted to emphasize
something else also mentioned in
religious texts that setbacks are normal
and part of an epic struggle towards
their end goal in May 2016 spin-doctor
Alert nanny downplayed the importance of
territory saying that real Muslims can
only be defeated if the Koran are
removed from their hearts and he said
they could now retreat into the desert
to regroup as they've done in the past a
LED nanny was killed in an airstrike
soon after over the last year Isis
leader Abu Bakr al-baghdadi has
emphasized faith in steadfastness he
urged soldiers of the Caliphate to keep
fighting and to attack from the group's
so-called provinces and Isis has
increasingly appeared to be reminiscing
in its publications about how successful
their Caliphate had been as inspiration
to keep fighting for what has now been
lost the numbers of Westerners traveling
to join Isis has dropped significantly
the group recently resorted to trying to
recruit women and even floated the idea
of crime as a form of jihad this appears
to send out a new message one of
survival but for thousands of fighters
still connected to the group's difficult
ideology there's no going back the only
way forwards is to keep fighting with or
without a caliphate
